title: How much are knock-off iPhones? - Quora

response.answer_text: Knock off or fake iPhones are usually priced anywhere from £50 for a less accurate model to sometimes up to a few hundred, I personally wouldn’t see the point in buying one because you can get much better androids if you are planning on using it and if it was purely for show you could look at getting display phone, like the ones they use in store windows which some are physically the same as a real iPhone they just don’t actually work however they are much cheaper.

There’s two methods to selling knock-off phones. 1.) Sell it for much less, but still enough that you get a profit, so ~50 $ or less 2.) Sell it for the same price or a slight discount of a legit one The former is more common.
